name: market for sawlog and veneer log, softwood, measured as solid wood under bark | sawlog and veneer log, softwood, measured as solid wood under bark | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10592/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This dataset represents the global market for sawlog and veneer log, softwood Transport distances are based on expert judgment and on the ecoinvent Default Transport Assumptions for global transport, accessible at https://www.ecoinvent.org/files/transport_default_20191112.xlsx, based on transport statistics, according to a methodology developed by Borken & Weidema (2013).

Activity starts in the forest, with the delivery of the sawlogs and veneer logs.

Activity ends with the delivery of the product to the consumers.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/022:Logging/0220:Logging

flow.name: sawlog and veneer log, softwood, measured as solid wood under bark
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/022:Logging/0220:Logging

exchanges.description: The total marine transport volume differentiated into major commodity groups based on data from FearnResearch (2001): Fearnley's Annual Review 2000. Oslo: Fearnley/AS, p. 1-78. The category “Other cargo” accounts for 38% of total maritime transport volume and has been distributed on commodity groups based on the proportions in the marine import and export of the US in 2001-2010. Although some countries import sawlogs and veneer logs, this is uncommon. For that reason, it is estimated that most logs are never transported by transoceanic ship. The average transport is thus reduced by 90%.
